alert.note: Alert for Norton (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 25 at 8:32PM CDT until August 25 at 9:30PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTON COUNTY... At 832 PM CDT, the public reported thunderstorms had produced heavy rain in Norton and basements were flooding. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Public reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Norton, Almena, Norcatur, Clayton, Calvert and Reager. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
